context.mentor_persona: [mentor] is a caring and nurturing mentor. [mentor] likes to create a safe and supportive environment for their mentee. [mentor] is always looking for ways to help them grow and develop their skills.
context.mentee_persona: [mentee] is a perfectionist with great attention to detail. [mentee] likes things to be done the right way and has a hard time delegating tasks to others. [mentee] is critical of himself and of others.

topic: never use a notebook for taking notes
always end function argument names with '_i'
session_eval_query: function that returns the kth largest element in an array
function that merges two sorted lists
history_eval_query: function that returns the kth largest element in an array
function that merges two sorted lists
sessions.text:
Sophia: Good morning, Sylvie. It's nice to finally meet you. I'm Sophia, the new software engineering intern.

Sylvie: Good morning, Sophia. It's a pleasure to meet you too. I'm Sylvie, your mentor here at PACE. I hope you're settling in well.

Sophia: Yes, I am. I'm excited to be here and looking forward to learning from you.

Sylvie: Great! Mentorship is very important to me, and I want to provide you with all the support you need. Now, before we dive into things, I want to give you a few guidelines that will help us work effectively together.

Sophia: Of course. I'm all ears.

Sylvie: Firstly, I want you to ditch the notebook. Taking notes by hand can be cumbersome and inefficient. I want us to use a more modern approach. From now on, I'd like you to take all your notes digitally.

Sophia: Understood. I'll start taking digital notes from today itself.

Sylvie: Excellent! Now, moving on to some coding guidelines. I want you to pay extra attention to this. It's important that we maintain consistency and clarity in our code.

Sophia: Absolutely. Consistency is key.

Sylvie: Indeed. One of the things I insist on is the use of annotations for functions. Annotations provide valuable information about the type of data a function expects and returns. They make the code more readable and self-documenting.

Sophia: I agree. Annotations are indeed helpful, especially when collaborating with a team.

Sylvie: Exactly. Additionally, I want you to follow a specific naming convention for function argument names. End all function argument names with '_i'.  This helps us quickly identify function arguments in the code.

Sophia: I understand. I'll make sure to end all my function argument names with '_i' from now on.

Sylvie: Perfect. Maintaining consistent and clear code is crucial, especially as we work with a large codebase and collaborate with multiple team members.

Sophia: I can imagine. Consistency makes it easier for everyone to understand and work with the code.

Sylvie: Absolutely. Now, these guidelines might take a little while to get used to, but they'll become second nature soon enough. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or concerns along the way.

Sophia: I will. Thank you for taking the time to guide me, Sylvie. I really appreciate it.

Sylvie: You're very welcome, Sophia. Mentoring is a rewarding experience for me as well. Let's make this a productive and enjoyable journey together.

Sophia: I'm glad we're on the same page. I'm excited to get started and learn as much as I can from you.

Sylvie: That's the spirit! Now, shall we dive into something more specific, or would you like a tour of our systems first?

Sophia: A tour would be great. It would help me get familiar with the tools and resources at my disposal.

Sylvie: Fantastic! Let's get started then. I'll show you the ropes and introduce you to the wonderful world of PACE's engineering ecosystem.
